alert.note: Alert for Love; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 15 at 7:53PM CDT until June 15 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Love County in southern Oklahoma... Southern Marshall County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 845 PM CDT. * At 753 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles east of Burneyville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Marietta, Thackerville, Woodville, Willis, western Lake Texoma, and Burneyville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area.
